source:
（伊織が雑誌を読んでいるみたいだ……。
声をかけてみよう）
translatedstr:
(It looks like Iori is reading a magazine. ......
(Let's call out to her.)

source: 伊織、何を読んでいるんだ？
translatedstr: Iori, what are you reading?

source:
ん、これ？　海外の情報雑誌よ。スーパーアイドルの
伊織ちゃんは、忙しくてロクに海外旅行も出来ないの
translatedstr:
Hmm, what's this? It's an international magazine about Super Idol.
Iori is too busy to travel overseas.

source:
だからせめて、
雑誌を見ながら旅行の想像しているのよ
translatedstr:
So at least,
I'm looking at a magazine and imagining the trip.

source:
そうだな、伊織も頑張ってるし、
どこか旅行に行けるといいな……
translatedstr:
Yes, Iori is doing her best,
Hope you can travel somewhere: ......

source: （伊織が海外旅行と言ったら……）
translatedstr: (When Iori says international travel, he means ......)

source: ヨーロッパ
translatedstr: Europe

source: ハワイ
translatedstr: Hawaii

source: 温泉
translatedstr: hot spring

source: 伊織は、ヨーロッパの街並みとか似合いそうだな！
translatedstr: Iori would look good in a European cityscape or something!

source:
いい場所を選んだわね！　ふふ、ヨーロッパは、
超絶美少女伊織ちゃんにぴったりね♪
translatedstr:
You picked a great place! Hmmm, Europe,
Perfect for Iori, a super beautiful girl.

source: 芸能人と言ったら……ハワイか！
translatedstr: When you say celebrity, you mean ...... Hawaii!

source:
たまにはハワイもよさそうね。子どもの頃は、
毎年行ってたけど……最近行ってないものね
translatedstr:
Hawaii sounds nice once in a while, when I was a kid,
I used to go every year, but I haven't been to ...... lately.

source:
遠出するほどの暇がないなら、
近場の温泉にでも入って、気分転換するのはどうかな
translatedstr:
If you don't have time to travel far,
How about a trip to a nearby hot spring for a change of pace?

source:
あのね、旅行に行きたいって話だったでしょ？
温泉というか、スパで気分転換は悪くない発想だけど
translatedstr:
You know, you told me you wanted to go on a trip, right?
A spa, or rather, a spa for a change of pace, is not a bad idea.

source:
よし！　ルミナスが無事目標を達成したら、
みんなで慰安旅行に行こう！
translatedstr:
Okay, if Luminous successfully achieves its goal,
Let's go on a comfort trip together!

source:
あら、うちの事務所にそんな予算があるの？
でも、楽しみにしておくわね♪
translatedstr:
Oh, you have that kind of budget in our office?
But I'll look forward to it. ♪

source:
（伊織とふたりで、伊織中心のミニライブの
打ち合わせをしている……）
translatedstr:
(Iori and Iori together, Iori-centered mini live performance.
(......)

source:
よし、大体セットリストは決まったな。
他に決めておくことは……と
translatedstr:
Okay, I think we've got a rough set list.
Other things to decide are ...... and

source:
ねぇ、このスーパーアイドル伊織ちゃんが
もっと輝くアイディアって、ないのかしら？
translatedstr:
Hey, this super idol Iori...
I wonder if there's an idea that would shine brighter?

source:
もっと輝くアイディア……か。
勿論、歌以外でってことだよな？
translatedstr:
More shiny ideas ......?
You mean besides singing, of course?

source:
もちろん！　せっかくだもの、
ファンが驚くようなことじゃなきゃ！
translatedstr:
Of course!
It has to be something that surprises the fans!

source: （ファンが驚くような演出のアイディア……か）
translatedstr: (Fans will be amazed at the production ideas at ...... or)

source: ワイヤーアクション
translatedstr: wire action

source: 光り輝くステージ
translatedstr: Luminous stage

source: ステージからダイブ
translatedstr: Dive from the stage

source:
そうだな、思い切ってワイヤーアクション！
……なんてどうだ？
translatedstr:
Yes, boldly wire action!
How about ......?

source:
天使のように舞い降りる伊織ちゃんってことね！
にひひっ♪　私にピッタリのアイディアじゃない
translatedstr: So you're Iori, soaring like an angel!

source:
ステージのライティングを派手にして
光り輝くステージっていうのはどうだ？
translatedstr:
Make the stage lighting flashy.
How about a shiny stage?

source:
ふぅん……悪くはないわね。でもそれって
私じゃなくて、ステージが目立ちそうじゃない？
translatedstr:
Hmmm......... not bad...but that's just
Not me, but doesn't the stage stand out?

source:
ステージから客席にダイブ！
なんてのはどうだ？　危ないか……
translatedstr:
Dive from the stage to the audience!
How's that for a good idea? Care to take a look: ......

source:
そ、それは……客席に直接落ちるの？
ちょっと怖いわね……。怪我しそうだし……
translatedstr:
So, does that fall directly on the ...... audience?
It's a little scary. ....... I think I might get hurt. ......

source:
まあ、まだミニライブまでには時間もあるし、
急いで決める必要はないよ。一緒に考えていこう
translatedstr:
Well, there is still time before the mini-live,
There's no need to rush into a decision, we'll figure it out together.

source:
そうね、大事なライブだもの。私も考えてみるから、
もっといい案があったら、すぐに連絡してくれる？
translatedstr:
Well, it's an important concert, I'll think about it,
If you have a better idea, will you get back to me ASAP?

source:
ああ、もちろん！
いいライブにしような
translatedstr:
Yes, of course!
Let's make it a good show.

source:
（ん……？　伊織が何か見てるな。
声をかけてみよう）
translatedstr:
(Nn......? Iori is looking at something.
(Let's call out to her.)

source:
伊織、何を見てるんだ……？
って、杏が置いていったぬいぐるみか
translatedstr:
Iori, what are you looking at ......?
I mean, is that the stuffed animal that Anzu left behind?

source:
そうよ。でも、ぬいぐるみっていうより、
杏のことね。……なんだかアレに似てるな、って
translatedstr:
Yes, but it's more like a stuffed animal,
You mean Anzu. ...... I thought it kind of looked like that one.

source: （アレ……？　杏に似ているのって言えば……）
translatedstr: (That thing ......? If you say it looks like Anzu, it's ......)

source: 美希
translatedstr: Miki

source: 俺
translatedstr: I

source: 伊織
translatedstr: Iori

source:
杏が似てるって、もしかして美希、か？
ふたりとも昼寝が好きだしな
translatedstr:
Anzu looks like, maybe Miki, huh?
They both like to nap.

source:
あら、正解よ♪　
美希と杏って、ちょっと似てるわよね
translatedstr:
Oh, you're right.
Miki and Anzu are a bit alike, aren't they?

source: 杏が似てるっていうのは……俺、なんてな！
translatedstr: Anzu looks like ...... me, oh my!

source:
ああ、アンタも普段ボーっとしているのに、やる時は
やる……って、違うわよ、美希のことを話してるの！
translatedstr:
Yeah, you're usually in a daze, but when you do it, you do it.
I'm going to do ......, no, I'm talking about Miki!

source: 杏が似てるのは……、ああ、伊織か！
translatedstr: Anzu looks like ......, oh, and Iori!

source:
どうして伊織ちゃんになるのよ！
私が話してるのは、美希のこと！
translatedstr:
Why do you have to be Iori?
I am talking about Miki!

source:
伊織もうさぎのぬいぐるみを持っているから、
杏のぬいぐるみが欲しいのかと思ったよ
translatedstr:
Because Iori also has a stuffed rabbit,
I thought you wanted a stuffed Anzu.

source:
そんなわけないでしょ。美希と杏って、ステージでは
しっかりアイドルなところが、似てるって思ったの
translatedstr:
Miki and Anzu are not like that on stage.
I thought we were similar in that we were both idols.

source:
はは、確かにな。それなら、伊織と杏も
いいコンビになるってことだな！
translatedstr:
Ha, indeed, then, Iori and Anzu, too.
That means they'll make a good pair!

source:
そんなの……私の面倒が増えるだけじゃない。
ま、別にいいんだけど……！
translatedstr:
That's not just more trouble for ...... me.
Well, it doesn't matter. ......

source: （今日は伊織と街に買い物に出ている）
translatedstr: (Iori and I are out shopping in town today)

source:
お、ここ、小学生の『将来の夢』の絵を
展示し始めたのか。たくさんあるな
translatedstr:
Oh, here, a picture of an elementary school student's "Dream of the Future".
You've started exhibiting...lots of them.

source:
ふふ、いろんな将来の夢があるのね。そういえば
アンタって子どもの頃、何になりたかったの？
translatedstr:
Hmmm...you have many dreams for the future, come to think of it.
What did you want to be when you were a child?

source:
子どもの頃の夢か。
よく覚えていないなぁ……なんだったかな
translatedstr:
A childhood dream?
I don't remember exactly. ...... what was it?

source: （伊織の子どもの頃の夢って、なんだろう？）
translatedstr: (I wonder what Iori's childhood dream was?)

source: 普通の女の子
translatedstr: Ordinary girl

source: お姫様
translatedstr: princess

source: 水瀬グループ総帥
translatedstr: General Manager, Mizuse Group

source:
伊織の子どもの頃の夢は、普通の女の子に
なりたい！　……とかだったりしたのか？
translatedstr:
Iori's childhood dream was to be a normal girl.
I want to be! Was it something like ......?

source:
まぁ、そんな時もあったかもね……
私が恵まれた環境だってことくらい、分かってたし
translatedstr:
Well, maybe there was a time for that. ......
I knew I was blessed.

source:
伊織の子どもの頃の夢は、お姫様とかか？
すごく似合いそうだけど……
translatedstr:
Iori's childhood dream was to be a princess or something?
It looks really good on you. ......

source:
ふふん。これだけ超絶美少女なんだから、
お姫様なんて、似合って当然でしょ？
translatedstr:
Hmmm...so much for being a super beautiful girl,
A princess deserves to look good, don't you think?

source:
伊織の子どもの頃の夢……それは、
水瀬グループの総帥！　だったりしないか？
translatedstr:
Iori's childhood dream: ...... that is,
The general manager of the Mizuse Group!

source:
しないけど？　まだそんな大きな夢は
持ってなかったわよ。……子どもだったから
translatedstr:
I don't dream that big yet.
I didn't have one. ...... I was a child.

source:
そうか。でも今の伊織は、トップアイドル……。
いつ頃から、アイドルになろうと思ってたんだ？
translatedstr:
Okay, but now Iori is a top idol .......
When did you know you wanted to become an idol?

source:
それは……いつだっていいじゃないの。
気がついたらもう、私はアイドルになってたわ
translatedstr:
That's not ...... anytime you want.
Next thing I know, I'm already an idol.

source:
そうなのか……俺もいつの間にか、みんなを
輝かせたいって思って、今の仕事を選んでたよ
translatedstr:
I don't know, I'm not sure when ...... I'm going to get you guys.
I chose the job I have because I wanted to shine.

source:
なら伊織ちゃんはもちろん、ルミナスを更に輝かせて
ちょうだいね。アンタならできるでしょ、にひひっ♪
translatedstr:
Then, of course, Iori can make Luminous shine even brighter.
You can do it, right?

source: （仕事帰り、お祭りの屋台通りのそばを通った）
translatedstr: (On my way home from work, I walked by the street of festival stalls)

source:
あ、今日がお祭りだったのか。提灯とか出てたから、
近いとは思ってたが……しかし、人がたくさんいるな
translatedstr:
Oh, so today was the festival, because there were lanterns and stuff,
I knew it was close ...... but there's a lot of people here.

source:
ちょうどいいわね。プロデューサー、小腹が空いたし、
何か縁日っぽい食べ物を、買ってちょうだい♪
translatedstr:
Just in time, producer, I'm hungry,
Please buy me something to eat at the fair.

source:
そうだな、少し小腹も空いたしな。
伊織が喜びそうな縁日の食べ物はっと……
translatedstr:
Yes, I'm a little hungry.
Iori will be happy to see the food at the fair: ......

source: りんご飴
translatedstr: toffee apple

source: たこ焼き
translatedstr: octopus dumplings

source: じゃがバター
translatedstr: potato (Solanum tuberosum)

source:
縁日の屋台といえば、りんご飴なんてどうだ？
甘いけどさっぱりもしてて、美味しいぞ
translatedstr:
Speaking of fair stalls, how about candy apples?
Sweet but refreshing and delicious!

source:
ふぅん、りんご飴……いいじゃない。アンタも
この伊織ちゃんの喜ばせ方、分かってきたようね♪
translatedstr:
Hmmm, candy apples...... are good, and so are you.
You seem to have figured out how to please this Iori girl.

source:
うん、食欲をそそるソースのいい匂いだ！
たこ焼きはどうだ？
translatedstr:
Yeah, that's a nice, appetizing sauce smell!
How about some takoyaki?

source:
たこ焼き……普段はあんまり食べないし、
縁日っぽくていいんじゃない？
translatedstr:
Takoyaki...... I don't usually eat much,
It looks like a fair, doesn't it?

source: あ、じゃがバターの屋台が出てるぞ
translatedstr: Oh, there's a stall selling potato butter.

source:
あのじゃがいも、大きすぎじゃない？
私が持って歩くには無理があるわよ
translatedstr:
Aren't those potatoes too big?
There's no way I'm going to be able to walk around with it.

source: 他にもたくさん食べ物の屋台が並んでるな
translatedstr: Lots of other food stalls lined up.

source:
私、食べ歩きするの、実は好きなのよね。
ケーキは売ってないかしら？
translatedstr:
I actually like to eat and walk around.
I wonder if they sell cake?

source:
うーん……屋台でケーキは流石に無いと思うぞ。
けど、少し時間もあるし、一緒に回って見てみるか？
translatedstr:
Hmmm ...... I don't think the cakes in the stalls are quintessential.
But we have a little time, so why don't we go around and look at it together?

source:
そうね。せっかくのお祭りだもの、しょうがないから
一緒に行ってあげるわ。にひひっ♪
translatedstr:
Well, it's a festival, so I can't help it.
I'll go with you.

source:
（伊織の仕事終わり、
気分転換を兼ねて公園に散歩に来た）
translatedstr:
(Iori's end of work,
(I came for a walk in the park for a change of pace.)

source:
あ～、疲れた。伊織ちゃん、のどがカラカラだわ。
ね、なにか飲み物を買ってきてくれない？
translatedstr:
Oh, I'm so tired, Iori, my throat is parched.
Hey, can you get me something to drink?

source:
そうだな、結構歩いたし、ちょっと疲れたな。
そこに自販機があるし、買ってくるよ
translatedstr:
Yes, we walked quite a bit, and I'm a little tired.
There's a vending machine there. I'll get some.

source: （ええと、何にしようかな……）
translatedstr: (Uh, what shall we call it: ......)

source: フルーツジュース
translatedstr: fruit juice

source: お汁粉
translatedstr: sweet red-bean soup

source: お茶
translatedstr: tea ceremony

source: 伊織、飲み物を買ってきたぞ
translatedstr: Iori, I got you a drink.

source:
あら、ありがと。
アンタも伊織ちゃんのこと分かってるじゃない♪
translatedstr:
Oh, thanks.
You know Iori too, don't you?

source: （よし！　すごく喜んでくれているな……！）
translatedstr: (Okay! You're making me very happy. ......!)

source: 伊織、飲み物を買ってきたぞ
translatedstr: Iori, I got you a drink.

source:
ありがとう……あら、ちょっと変わったものを
買ってきたわね？　ふふっ♪　面白そうじゃない
translatedstr:
Thanks ...... Oh, well, something a little different.
You bought it, didn't you? Hmmm... it looks interesting.

source: （ふう、どうやら喜んでくれたみたいだ）
translatedstr: (Phew, apparently he's pleased.)

source: 伊織、飲み物を買ってきたぞ
translatedstr: Iori, I got you a drink.

source:
ありがと、プロデューサー……って、
私、缶入りのお茶は苦手よ。知らなかった？
translatedstr:
Thanks, I'm a producer ......,
I don't like tea in a can, didn't you know?

source: （うーん、あまり喜んでくれなかったみたいだ……）
translatedstr: (Hmmm, I don't think he was too happy about it. ......)

source: （仕事をしていたら、伊織がやってきた）
translatedstr: (I was working, and Iori came over.)

source:
（事務所にいた子たちとジャンケンをして、負け
続けて悔しいらしく、俺に挑んできたそうだ……）
translatedstr:
(She played rock-paper-scissors with the kids in the office and lost.
She continued to be frustrated and challenged me (......).

source:
アンタには負けないんだから。
私、パーを出すからね！　分かってるわよね？
translatedstr:
I'm not going to lose to you.
I'm going to put up a par! You know that, right?

source: （心理戦をしかけてきたぞ。さて、どうするか……）
translatedstr: (She's playing mind games...now what to do ......)

source: 勝ちを譲る
translatedstr: concede victory

source: あいこにする
translatedstr: do with favor (favour)

source: 勝ちに行く
translatedstr: go for the win

source: ジャンケン、ポンッ！　グーだ！
translatedstr: Rock, paper, scissors!

source:
や、やっと勝ったわ！　……伊織ちゃんが
勝つのは当然だから、別に嬉しくないけどっ
translatedstr:
Ya, I finally won! ...... Iori is the one!
I'm not really happy about it, because I deserve to win!

source: （よし！　すごく喜んでくれているな……！）
translatedstr: (Okay! You're making me very happy. ......!)

source: ジャンケン、ポンッ！　パー！
translatedstr: Rock, paper, scissors!

source:
あいこね……アンタ、いい度胸してるじゃないの。
覚悟しなさい、次は私が勝つんだから！
translatedstr:
Aikone...... you have some nerve.
Brace yourself, because next time I'm going to win!

source: （ふう。どうやら喜んでくれたみたいだ）
translatedstr: (Wind...apparently he was pleased.)

source: ジャンケン、ポンッ！　チョキ！
translatedstr: Rock, paper, scissors!

source:
ま、また負けた……ちょっとアンタ、
どういうつもりなのよーっ！
translatedstr:
Well, I lost again ...... hey Anta,
What are you trying to do?

source:
（しまった、裏をかいたつもり
だったんだが……失敗だったな）
translatedstr:
(Oh shit, I thought I had it backwards.
(I was, but ...... was a mistake.)

source:
（伊織が雑誌を読みながら休憩しているな。
なんの雑誌を読んでるんだ？）
translatedstr:
(I see Iori is taking a break while reading a magazine.
(What magazine are you reading?)

source:
伊織、何を読んで……って、情報誌か。
なにか知りたいことでもあるのか？
translatedstr:
Iori, what are you reading ......, an information magazine?
Is there something you want to know?

source:
ルミナスのメンバーで行けそうな場所を探してるの。
息抜きにもなるしね。アンタ、いい案ない？
translatedstr:
I'm looking for a place where I could go with Luminous members.
I'll take a break from it.

source: （ルミナスのみんなで行けそうなところ、か……）
translatedstr: (Where everyone in Luminous could go, or ......)

source: ショッピングモール
translatedstr: shopping mall

source: 動物園
translatedstr: zoo

source: 噴水広場
translatedstr: fountain square

source:
ショッピングモールなんてどうだ？
みんなで買い物するのも楽しそうだしな
translatedstr:
How about a shopping mall?
And it would be fun to shop together.

source:
あら、なかなかいいアイディアじゃない！
今度遊びに行く時の参考にするわ、にひひっ♪
translatedstr:
Oh, that's a pretty good idea!
I'll use it as a reference next time I go to visit. nihihihihihihi♪

source: （よし！　すごく喜んでくれているな……！）
translatedstr: (Okay! You're making me very happy. ......!)

source:
動物園とかかな。
息抜きにもなりそうだし、どうだろう？
translatedstr:
Maybe a zoo or something.
It would be a good way to let off steam.

source:
ちょっとした遠足みたいになりそうね。
まあ、悪くないんじゃない？
translatedstr:
Sounds like a bit of a field trip.
Well, that's not bad, is it?

source: （ふう。どうやら喜んでくれたみたいだ）
translatedstr: (Wind...apparently he was pleased.)

source:
噴水広場とか……？　広場でダンスとかしてる子も
いるから、伊織達もレッスンできるんじゃないか？
translatedstr:
Fountain Square or ......? Some kids dancing or something in the square.
Iori and the others can take lessons since they are there, right?

source:
息抜きで遊びに行くつもりなのに、
レッスンのこと考えたら逆効果でしょ？
translatedstr:
I'm just going to take a break and have some fun,
It's counterproductive, isn't it, considering the lesson?

source: （うーん、あまり喜んでくれなかったみたいだ……）
translatedstr: (Hmmm, I don't think he was too happy about it. ......)

source:
（伊織の仕事終わり、
気分転換を兼ねて出かけることにした……）
translatedstr:
(Iori's end of work,
I decided to go out for a change (......)

source:
（もうこんな時間か……。
伊織も楽しんでくれたようだな）
translatedstr:
(Is it that time already? .......
(Iori seems to have had a good time.)

source:
にひひっ♪　今日は楽しかったわ。この次も、
伊織ちゃんを楽しませるように。わかった？
translatedstr:
NIHIHI ♪ I had fun today, and next time,
Iori, please entertain Iori.

source:
今日はありがと。ま、アンタにしてはよくやったわ。
次もしっかりエスコートしなさいよねっ
translatedstr:
Thanks for today, well done for you.
Make sure you escort me next time, okay?

source:
やあ、伊織。おはよう。

translatedstr:
Hi Iori, good morning.
I know it's early in the morning, but ......, what did you need today?

source:
あら、プロデューサー。おはよう。
たまたま早起きしちゃっただけよ
translatedstr:
Good morning, producer.
I just happened to get up early.

source:
そうか。なら少し話しながら事務所に行こうか。
そうだな……ルミナスの調子はどうだ？
translatedstr:
Well, then let's go to the office for a little chat.
Yeah, how's the ...... luminous going?

source:
ふふん♪　このトップアイドルの水瀬伊織ちゃんが
いるんだから、ルミナスもトップ間違いなしね！
translatedstr:
Hmmm... this top idol, Iori Minase...
I'm sure Luminous will be at the top of the list, too!

source:
いつも通りということか。
それは良かった
translatedstr:
So it's business as usual.
That's good to know.

source:
そう！　だからアンタも私に負けないように
頑張りなさいよね！　無理しない程度に、だけど
translatedstr:
That's right! So don't let me down, you too.
You should go for it! Just don't overdo it, though.

source: ああ、一緒に頑張っていこうな
translatedstr: Yeah, we're going to do great together.

source:
あら？
プロデューサーじゃない、おはよう
translatedstr:
Oh?
Not the producer. Good morning.

source:
伊織。おはよう、
この時間に会うなんて、珍しいな
translatedstr:
Good morning, Iori,
It's unusual for us to meet at this hour.

source:
そうね。朝早くから伊織ちゃんに会えるなんて、
ラッキーじゃない。今日はいいことがあるわよ
translatedstr:
Yes, it's great to see Iori early in the morning,
You're in luck...today is going to be a good day!

source: はは、そうかもしれないな
translatedstr: Ha, maybe you're right.

source:
にひひっ♪　せっかくだから、このまま

translatedstr:
NIHIHIHI♪ Since we're here, let's just leave it at that.
I could use an escort to the office.

source:
ああ、もちろん。
それじゃあ一緒に事務所まで行こうか
translatedstr:
Yes, of course.
Then I'll walk with you to the office.

source:
ふふっ♪
よろしく頼むわね！
translatedstr: I'm looking forward to working with you!

source:
プロデューサー……？
アンタ、こんな時間まで仕事してたの？
translatedstr:
Produced by ......?
You've been working this late?

source:
ああ、伊織か。
仕事はもう終わって、ちょうど帰るところだ
translatedstr:
Ah, Iori.
I'm done with work and just about to leave.

source:
ふーん……。ここのところ、プロデュース、

translatedstr:
Hmmm ....... produce these days,

source: 伊織にそう言われると励みになるな
translatedstr: It's encouraging to hear Iori say that.

source:
ふふ、でしょう？　これからも、しっかり
励んでよね。……でも、無理はしないこと。いい？
translatedstr:
I'm sure you will, won't you? Keep up the good work.
Keep up the good work. ...... but don't overdo it, okay?

source: ああ、ありがとな伊織
translatedstr: Yeah, thanks Iori.

source:
別に……当然のことを言っただけよ。
それじゃ、お先に。お疲れさま
translatedstr:
Not really. ...... I was just stating the obvious.
Good day to you.

source:
（伊織に新作オレンジジュースの
キャンペーンガールの依頼が入った）
translatedstr:
(Iori with the new orange juice.
(Campaign Girl has been asked to be a campaign girl.)

source:
伊織、オレンジジュースが好きだったよな？
今回の仕事、まさにぴったりじゃないか
translatedstr:
Iori, you liked orange juice, didn't you?
This job, isn't it just perfect?

source:
ええ、そうよ。伊織ちゃん以上に、

translatedstr:
Yes, more so than Iori,
There is no better idol for this job!

source:
そうだな。好きなものの仕事か……。

translatedstr:
Yes, a job for something you love or .......

そうね、この伊織ちゃんを起用するなんて、

translatedstr:
I agree, I can't believe they used Iori here,

スーパーアイドル伊織ちゃんが、このジュースを

Yes, that's the spirit, and if it sells juice,

As long as I'm in charge, it's bound to sell!

伊織ちゃんが普通の売り方をしても、つまらないわ♪
ねえ、なにかいい考えはないかしら？
translatedstr:
Iori's normal way of selling is boring... ♪

なるほど、ちょっと変わった売り方か。
じゃあ……
translatedstr:
I see, a slightly different way of selling.
Then ......

source: 路上で伊織が配る

source: とにかく褒める
translatedstr: Anyway, praise her.

source: いつも通り宣伝する
translatedstr: Advertise as usual.

source: 伊織の実家を頼る
translatedstr: Rely on Iori's parents' home

source:
伊織が直接路上で配ってみるのはどうだ？

How about Iori handing them out in person on the street?

source:
にひひっ♪　そうね、話題にならないはずないわね！

NIHHIHI ♪ Yes, how could it not be a topic of conversation?

あっ、でも私が配ることが事前にわかっちゃったら

Oh, but if they find out in advance that I'm going to hand them out...

新商品のオレンジジュースよ。

translatedstr:
It's our new orange juice.

source:
えっ！？　伊織ちゃんじゃないか！　伊織ちゃんが

translatedstr:
What? It's Iori, isn't it?
I can't drink the juice ...... you gave me because it's too good to waste!

（伊織が直接サンプルドリンクを手渡すシークレット

translatedstr:
(Secret: Iori directly hands out sample drinks.
(The event ...... that made the juice a big hit!)

source:
（思惑通りにオレンジジュースブームも

translatedstr:
(And the orange juice boom, as I suspected.

そうだな、伊織が試飲して、

Yes, Iori tasted it,
How about a compliment on the new juice?

source:
なんだかヒネリのない感じだけど、悪くないわね。
さっき試飲させてもらったけど、美味しかったしね♪
translatedstr:
It's kind of twitchy, but not bad.
I got to taste it a while ago and it was delicious.Â

source:
ゴクゴク……ぷはぁ♪　これが飲みたかったのよ！
伊織ちゃんも大満足な、最高のオレンジジュース！
translatedstr:
Goku goku ...... puhhhh... I wanted to drink this!
Iori is also very satisfied with the best orange juice!

source:
（伊織が実際に飲んで、オレンジジュースを

translatedstr:
(Iori actually drank and orange juice.

（口コミが広がり、ファン以外も購入してくれて

(Word of mouth spread, and non-fans also purchased the product.
Looks like they made some moderate sales!)

source:
あえて広告っぽさをなくして、伊織の

translatedstr:
Iori's daring to eliminate the advertisement-like

それってどういう狙いなのよ？

（ジュースはそこそこ売れたけれど、伊織の影響力は

translatedstr:
(Juice sold well, but Iori's influence was
(Not much felt right, and the client had a clouded look on her face.)

伊織の実家、水瀬グループの大企業の力を使おう。

translatedstr:

アンタ、私の力だけじゃ売れないって思ってるの？

translatedstr:

...... Okay, I'll do as you say.

（伊織は話をしてくれたが、企業同士の交渉は

translatedstr:
(Iori spoke with us, but negotiations between companies are
(The project itself was abandoned due to difficulties ......)

source: （今回の仕事は成功だ！）
translatedstr: (This job was a success!)

translatedstr: （This job was a mistake...next time!)

伊織、ＴＶの仕事だ。

どんな内容かしら？

translatedstr:
Let's see, ...... theme is "Idol x Mountain Girl" or .......

伊織、ロケで山に行くみたいなんだが、

translatedstr:
Iori, I think we're going to the mountains for a location shoot,

あら、もしかして山が平気か心配しているの？

Oh, you're worried about whether the mountain will be okay?

source:
乗馬で高原にか……でも、今回の企画は
どうも登山っぽくてな。用意が要るんじゃないか
translatedstr:
Riding on horseback on the plateau or ......, but this time the project is
I think it's a bit of a climb, and you'll need to be ready for it.

高原だって山みたいなものでしょ？

translatedstr:
Even the plateau is like a mountain, right?

source:
服とか持ち物とか……。
何を持っていけばいいのかしら？
translatedstr:
Clothes and belongings. .......
What should I bring?

source: そうだな、山に必要なものは……
translatedstr: Yes, the mountain needs ......

source: 靴
translatedstr: shoes

source: 服装
translatedstr: attire

source: 飲み物
translatedstr: drink

source: お弁当
translatedstr: bento (Japanese box lunch)

source:
とにかく靴だな。普段の靴じゃ山道は歩けないし、

translatedstr:
Anyway, it's shoes...I can't walk on mountain paths in my normal shoes,
You're in an unfamiliar situation, and that's why I think it's important to have the right shoes.

あら、的確なアドバイスね♪　それじゃあ早速、

translatedstr:
Well, that's good advice... Now then, let's get to it,

source:
伊織ちゃんの足を支えるんだから、

translatedstr:
You have to support Iori's legs,
Of course it's custom-made, right?

ねえ、プロデューサー、どんな登山シューズが

Hey, producer, what kind of climbing shoes are you wearing?

ああ、分かった。伊織が怪我をしないように、

translatedstr:

source:
（伊織はオーダーシューズで意気揚々と番組撮影に

translatedstr:
(Iori was elated to be filmed for the program in her custom-made shoes.

（伊織の靴も話題になった結果、商品化の相談が

translatedstr:
(Iori's shoes also became a topic of conversation, and as a result, we were asked to commercialize them.

服装かな。服装が大事だと思うぞ。

translatedstr:

source:
そうね、動きやすくて通気性もよくって、

translatedstr:
Yes, it's easy to move around and breathable,
I'll have to come up with some clothes that can get properly soiled.

source:
お気に入りのブランドのデザイナーに

translatedstr:
To the designers of your favorite brands.

source:
（確かに服は大事だった。おかげで伊織の登山は

translatedstr:
(Clothes were indeed important, and thanks to them, Iori's mountain climbing

source:
（ただ、山道が少し歩きにくそうだったから、

translatedstr:
(Just because the mountain path looked a little difficult to walk on,
(Maybe I should have thought about shoes, too.)

source:
飲み物がなくなったら大変だから、

translatedstr:
If we run out of drinks, we're in trouble,

そうね。じゃあ、アンタ、当日までに

Well, then, by the end of the day, you...

（オレンジジュースを用意していったけれど、

translatedstr:
(I had prepared orange juice, though,
(Along the way, I wanted some tea or water.)

source:
（伊織の具合が悪くなってしまい、
収録は中断になってしまった……）
translatedstr:
(Iori's condition became worse,
(The recording was interrupted: ......)

source:
そうだな、お腹が空いたら大変だし、

translatedstr:
Yes, it's hard when you're hungry,
I'll have to pack a lunch for you, too.

source:
そうね、お腹が空いたら動けないものね。
完璧なお弁当を用意するわ！
translatedstr:
Yes, you can't move when you're hungry.
I'll prepare the perfect lunch!

source:
（伊織の完璧なお弁当はすごく豪華だったが、
重すぎて山頂に辿り着けなかった……）
translatedstr:
(Although Iori's perfect lunch was absolutely gorgeous,
(Too heavy to reach the summit ......)

source: （今回の仕事は成功だ！）
translatedstr: (This job was a success!)

source: （今回の仕事は失敗だ。次こそは！）
translatedstr: （This job was a mistake...next time!)

source:
（雑誌で『水瀬伊織のライブＭＣの魅力に迫る！』

translatedstr:
(In the magazine, "Iori Minase's Live MC Attraction!")
(......), which will be the subject of a feature article.

伊織、今日はそのＭＣの取材のために、

translatedstr:
Iori, today is for that MC interview,
There's a magazine reporter at the gig.

source:
え、あれってライブ後のインタビューじゃなくて、

translatedstr:
Eh, that wasn't an interview after the concert,

あ、ああ。ライブの後よりも、ライブ開始前や

translatedstr:
Ah, ah...more than after the gig, before the gig starts or

source:
もしかして、取材内容を間違えて伝えてたか？
そうだとしたら俺のミスだな、すまん……
translatedstr:
Perhaps I misrepresented the content of the interview?

source:
そういえば……ライブ密着取材って書いてたわ……。
もう！　私が勝手にカン違いしただけよ！
translatedstr:
Oh, I remember writing ...... live close coverage. ......
Oh, my God, I just misinterpreted it!

source:
でも今日のＭＣで特別なことなんて、

translatedstr:
But nothing special about today's MC,

source:
プロデューサー、ちょっと参考までに聞くけど、

translatedstr:
Producer, I'm just asking for your information,

source: もっと魅力的なＭＣをするには、か……
translatedstr: To make your MC more attractive, or ......

source: お礼を言う
translatedstr: thank

source: いつも通り
translatedstr: as always

source: 甘えてみる
translatedstr: I'm going to spoil her.

source: 俺に言うみたいに
translatedstr: Like you're talking to me.

source:
そうだな、応援してくれるファンに
たまには素直にお礼を言ってみたらどうだ？
translatedstr:
Yes, to the fans who support us.

source:
たまにはってなによ、いつも言ってるでしょ？
でも、そうね……素直に言葉にするのも悪くないわね
translatedstr:
What do you mean sometimes? You always say that, don't you?

source:
にひひっ♪　スーパーアイドルとして、
ファンのみんなを、もっと夢中にさせちゃいそうね！
translatedstr:
Nihihihi♪ As a super idol,

source: ああ、きっとファンのみんなが喜んでくれるぞ！

source:
……ここから見ると、光がすごくきれい……。
みんなー、いつも応援してくれてありがとう！
translatedstr:
The light is so beautiful from here .......

source: こ、こちらこそ、ありがとう～！！
translatedstr: Thank you so much for this one~!

source:
（伊織とファンとの素直な応答に、記者も感激して

translatedstr:
(The reporter was thrilled by Iori's honest response with the fans.

（記事のおかげか、雑誌の売上もよく、
ライブも前より盛り上がるようになったぞ！）
translatedstr:
(Thanks to the article, the magazine sold well,
(And the live show just got more exciting than ever!)

source:
いつも通りのＭＣでいいんじゃないか？
伊織の魅力が一番伝わると思うぞ
translatedstr:
Just MC as usual, right?

source:
そうね、私は『世界のアイドル』だもの。
見てなさい、いつも通り盛り上げて見せるわ♪
translatedstr:
Yes, I am an "idol of the world.

source: ああ、頑張ってくれ！　頼んだぞ！
translatedstr: Yeah, good luck with that!

source:
次の曲は、みんなの大好きな伊織ちゃんのあの曲！
さ、いっしょに歌いましょ♪
translatedstr:
The next song is that Iori song that everyone loves!

source:
（記者は興奮した様子でメモを取っていた。

translatedstr:
(The reporter was taking notes with excitement.
(A later magazine article also conveyed the excitement of the occasion.)

source:
（記事のおかげか、雑誌の評判も良く、
伊織の自然な振る舞いも各所で好評だ！）
translatedstr:
(Thanks to the article, the magazine was well received,
(Iori's natural behavior has also been well received in various places!)

source:
たまには甘えた感じでファンに接するのも

translatedstr: Sometimes you have to treat your fans like they're spoiled.

source:
え？　甘え、って……たとえば、翼みたいな感じ？
私のそういう姿、ファンに見せていいのかしら
translatedstr:
What? Spoiled, like ...... for example, like wings?
I wonder if it's okay for my fans to see me like that.

source:
（甘えた雰囲気はファンに好評だったが、記事には
『もっと辛口の魅力が恋しい』と書かれた……）
translatedstr:
(The pampered atmosphere was well received by fans, but the article
'I miss the more dry charm,' it says (......).

source:
普段のステージでの伊織じゃなく、俺に接する
みたいに遠慮なく、色々言ってみたらどうだ？
translatedstr:
You treat me, not Iori on stage as you usually do.
Why don't you say things like, "I'm not afraid to say things like.

source:
ちょっと、普段の伊織ちゃんに文句でもあるの！？
……わかったわよ、やりたいようにやってやるわ
translatedstr:
Hey, do you have a problem with the usual Iori!
...... Okay, I'll do whatever I want.

source:
（ライブのＭＣで伊織はいつもよりも強気な発言を
繰り返し、記者もファンも唖然とさせてしまった）
translatedstr:
(Iori made a more forceful statement than usual during the live MC.
(Repeatedly, he stunned reporters and fans alike.)

source: （今回の仕事は成功だ！）
translatedstr: (This job was a success!)

source: （今回の仕事は失敗だ。次こそは！）
translatedstr: （This job was a mistake...next time!)

source:
……あら、プロデューサーじゃない。
今日もしっかり働きなさいよね♪
translatedstr:
...... Oh, no, I'm not a producer.
You've got to work hard today... ♪

source:
ちょっと、プロデューサー！　そんな眠たそうな
顔をしていないで、シャキっとしなさいよ！
translatedstr:
Hey, producer! You look so sleepy.
Don't be facetious, get your sh*t together!

source:
お疲れ様、プロデューサー。
明日も馬車馬のごとく働きなさい。にひひっ♪
translatedstr:
Good job, producer.
Work like a cart horse tomorrow.

source:
ふふっ、今日はどのバブルバスにしようかしら♪
プロデューサーも、しっかりと休みなさいよね
translatedstr:
Hmmm, I wonder which bubble bath I'll have today...
Producers, you better get some rest, too.
